response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "high", "Being 18 implies limited maturity and may correlate with heightened risk-taking behavior."],
    ["Gender", "medium", "Male is statistically more prone to recidivism, though individual factors matter as well."],
    ["Ethnicity", "low", "While he identifies as Hispanic, ethnicity alone is not a strong predictor without additional socio-economic context."],
    ["Criminal History", "high", "Six prior arrests and convictions indicate a strong pattern of criminal behavior increasing reoffense risk."],
    ["Substance Use", "high", "Recent and ongoing use of marijuana and cocaine significantly heightens risk of recidivism."],
    ["Employment Status", "high", "Holding no jobs in the past year suggests economic instability and fewer social bonds that deter recidivism."],
    ["Educational Status", "low", "Enrollment in school is a protective factor, although it may not fully counterbalance other risks."],
    ["Mental Health", "medium", "Recent depressive feelings indicate potential mental health issues which can impair judgment."],
    ["Social/Family Background", "medium", "Living alone and early unstable family/social environment may limit support systems."],
    ["Belief System", "medium", "Disconnection from spiritual or structured belief can sometimes correlate with reduced adherence to conventional norms."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 85
}

risk_factors: Being 18 implies limited maturity and may correlate with heightened risk-taking behavior.
Male is statistically more prone to recidivism, though individual factors matter as well.
While he identifies as Hispanic, ethnicity alone is not a strong predictor without additional socio-economic context.
Six prior arrests and convictions indicate a strong pattern of criminal behavior increasing reoffense risk.
Recent and ongoing use of marijuana and cocaine significantly heightens risk of recidivism.
Holding no jobs in the past year suggests economic instability and fewer social bonds that deter recidivism.
Enrollment in school is a protective factor, although it may not fully counterbalance other risks.
Recent depressive feelings indicate potential mental health issues which can impair judgment.
Living alone and early unstable family/social environment may limit support systems.
Disconnection from spiritual or structured belief can sometimes correlate with reduced adherence to conventional norms.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is an 18-year-old male who identifies himself as Hispanic. He has been arrested 6 times and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 5 inches and weighs 145 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He is enrolled in school at the present moment. He has held no jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
